summary: The module defines dataset utilities for automatic speech recognition that read pre‑computed audio feature manifests and associated transcriptions, apply optional preprocessing (normalization, augmentation, channel selection, silence trimming, RTTM‑based masking/dropping), and convert the text into token sequences using either byte‑pair‑encoding or character tokenizers. It also provides a processor for extracting text information from feature manifests.
business_intent: To supply ready‑to‑use, configurable ASR training data pipelines that map audio features to tokenized text, facilitating model development and experimentation with various preprocessing and tokenization strategies.
